column1: Thanks to the @KennedyMSU Democrats for helping to volunteer at our Gala of Friends community event last night in #Flint! https://t.co/bKJgvGieeC
Thanks to all of our supporters who came out last night in #Flint to support our campaign.  Democrats are fired up and ready to win in 2020! https://t.co/T2MphOxzZd

Great to be with @GaryPeters in Flint! Gary is fighting for Michigan families in the United States Senate. He's willing to work with anyone—Republican Democrat or Independent—to protect our Great Lakes lower health care costs and grow our state's economy. https://t.co/Nv5JVXPQKg
Great to give keynote remarks at the Genesee County Democratic Party dinner! The room was packed full of Democrats ready to organize and win in 2020! https://t.co/URBr1cYSgP

Thank you @IndivisibleMich for having me speak tonight! Your continued focus on the issues that matter most—health care boosting wages protecting Social Security cleaning up corruption— motivates me to keep fighting for you in Congress. https://t.co/fIhPzYmDpp

It's Congressman Kildee's birthday! Will you sign his card before tonight and help us wish Dan a happy birthday? We want to surprise him with best wishes from at least 5000 of his top supporters!  Sign Dan's card here: https://t.co/7Nx2KF74rd

There's lots of important issues voters care about.   But considering that tonight's #DemDebate is an hour away from my hometown of #Flint every candidate should be asked about their plans to ensure safe & affordable drinking water for all Americans. #DontForgetFlint
Always great to start my morning with the men and women of organized labor who helped to build America’s middle class! #DemDebate https://t.co/6AGTwZ3SzO

What happened to my hometown of #Flint is not an anomaly—it is a warning to the rest of the country. What happened to Flint is the sad but predictable outcome of a failed Republican philosophy of government that puts dollars and cents ahead of people and public health. #DemDebate

Tonight’s debate is an hour from my hometown of #Flint. It’s very disappointing that there hasn’t been a single question yet about ensuring clean water for all Americans. Access to safe and affordable drinking water should be a fundamental human right. #DemDebate
My squad at the #DemDebate—Democrats are fired up in Detroit ready to elect a President that puts working families not the wealthy and well-connected first! https://t.co/Afsw0chcYK
https://t.co/UyNCbABlsG

In 2016 Michigan voted for the President by less than 11000 votes. This time around in 2020 Michigan families have seen and lived @realDonaldTrump’s failed economic promises. They want a new president whomever our Democratic nominee is that will put working families first.

The President also said he would fix our crumbling roads bridges and water systems. Democrats want to work with his Administration on infrastructure but the President has not put forward any serious plan. Another broken economic promise for the families I represent. #DemDebate

.@realDonaldTrump has made promises to Michigan families that he has not kept. Instead of working to make the lives of middle class families better Trump has instead focused on tax cuts for the richest Americans and biggest corporations. 83% of the benefits went to the top 1%.

In 2016 then-candidate Trump came to Michigan & promised voters that “you won’t lose one plant I promise you that.” Today auto plants are closing and thousands of workers are getting pink slips. The President’s economic policies have failed working families. #DemDebate https://t.co/4JGdmnvSRw
My open letter to all Democratic presidential candidates ahead of tonight's #DemDebate in Detroit: https://t.co/cao93KZevR

What happened to my hometown of Flint is not an anomaly. Rather Flint is a warning to the entire country.   As candidates get ready for the Detroit #DemDebate the next President must get serious about tackling the drinking water crisis in our country. https://t.co/OA9BGBN4jh

If you’re a college student who wants to make a change in our political system check out @orgcorps2020! This is great paid training program opportunity to help get Democrats elected in 2020. Apply by April 8th here: https://t.co/2EfFu0fkyZ https://t.co/sHK5FzAzlM
Very happy to see that Detroit will host a Democratic presidential debate!  Heartland states like Michigan will be crucial in 2020. https://t.co/8wAeVDjpfH
Happy #StPatricksDay! Glad I could be with the Bay City community to celebrate at their annual St. Patrick’s Day parade today. https://t.co/8FqhLO9hJV

It’s always a great morning when I get to catch up with our brothers and sisters in labor. Glad I could be in Saginaw to talk about the importance of protecting workers’ pensions and how Congress can support the hardworking families of mid-Michigan. https://t.co/mqLVokPvg1

Democrats know that victory in 2020 means having the support of America’s heartland. Very happy to see the @DNC select Milwaukee for the convention! @TheDemocrats are fighting for greater economic opportunity & security for America’s hardworking families. https://t.co/1SBXRcRNc2
Thank you @BrandonDillon75 for your service to the @MichiganDems over the years. Our state wouldn’t be where it is today without your dedication & leadership.
Congratulations @LavoraBarnes! Excited about the future of our state and the entire @MichiganDems team under your leadership as Chair of our party. #MDPConvention
